title: [CURATOR-411] Fix various testing issues
body:
- disable testMissedDelete - it needs to be re-written
- overload setState() in TestZooKeeperServer to avoid bogus log message
- Turn off JMX logging in ZooKeeper
- TestReconfiguration was messed up by ZK 3.5.3 reconfig changes
- Added a method to Timing to take from a queue with timeouts and applied it to tests that needed it
- CURATOR-410 and CURATOR-409

title: CURATOR-410: Fix testPathsFromProtectingInBackground failing due to n…
body:
…ew CreateModes in Zookeeper 3.5.3

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-410

A few tests were also hanging indefinitely on failure, I've added some timeouts.

Would it be possible to set up a Jenkins or Travis build to build PRs, similar to how it works on other projects (e.g. https://github.com/apache/storm or https://github.com/apache/kafka)? It would make test failures easier to catch in review.

title: CURATOR-409: Fix unintentional override of getQuorumPeer in TestingQu…
body:
…orumPeerMain

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-409

I don't know if QuorumPeer is useful to users of curator-test, but getQuorumPeer isn't used anywhere in the code, so if it is possible to remove it entirely that's probably a nicer solution.

title: [CURATOR-407] Added ttl suppport to Create transactions
[CURATOR-404] AsyncTransactionCreateBuilder has API mistake
body:
intermediate AsyncTransactionCreateBuilder DSL methods should return AsyncPathAndBytesable not AsyncPathable.

The good news here is the 99.9% of old clients will still work as this is an intermediate API call only. e.g.

`client.transactionOp().create().compressed().forPath()` still works. It merely now gains the ability to set the byte array (as it should).

title: CURATOR-402: Curator should not use QuorumServer.addr when updating the connect string dynamically
body:
…e the client connect string, resulting in a client unable to reconnect

See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-402.

I took a look at adding a test for this, but both addresses are null when using a single testing server, and I couldn't find a way to start a testing cluster where clientAddr is null.

title: CURATOR-106: Ensure background operations happen in the background thread to avoid stack overflows when retrying guaranteed operations
body:
See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-106?focusedCommentId=15979112&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15979112

Also a few tests in TestNamespaceFacade were not passing because they were using blank connect strings. I'd be happy to open a separate issue for that change if necessary, or remove it if I misunderstood the tests.

title: CURATOR-401: Make InterProcessMutex.isOwnedByCurrentThread public
body: See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-401

title: [CURATOR-395] Potential null dereference in PersistentNode
body: localCreateMethod could be null in a race condition

title: Fix guava version incompatibility with MoreExecutors.sameThreadExecutor()
body:
Before I went to create this PR, I see similar ones have been closed several times, suggesting that it was addressed in https://github.com/apache/curator/pull/190 as part of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-200

This doesn't appear to actually address the issue, as this error occurs:

```
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors.sameThreadExecutor()Lcom/google/common/util/concurrent/ListeningExecutorService;
        at org.apache.curator.framework.listen.ListenerContainer.addListener(ListenerContainer.java:40)
        at org.apache.curator.framework.imps.CuratorFrameworkImpl.start(CuratorFrameworkImpl.java:256)
        at XXX.start(XXX.java:88)
```

I'm not familiar with shading, but it appears it's either not implemented or not working properly in this case (does shading rewrite the curator source files?). This error occurs with both 2.12.0 and 3.3.0.

title: [CURATOR-397] Strongly typed Model DSL
body:
This is a large PR but provides long needed modeling to ZooKeeper/Curator. I've made the PR's website doc available here: http://curator.apache.org/private/staging/curator-x-async/modeled.html

Also an example that uses all the APIs is here: https://github.com/apache/curator/tree/CURATOR-397/curator-examples/src/main/java/pubsub

The most important classes are here:

- [ZPath](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/ZPath.java)
- [ModelSpec](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/ModelSpec.java)
- [ModeledFramework](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/ModeledFramework.java)

Then:

- [CachedModeledFramework](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/cached/CachedModeledFramework.java)
- [TypedZPath](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/typed/TypedZPath.java)
- [TypedModelSpec](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/typed/TypedModelSpec.java)
- [TypedModeledFramework](https://github.com/apache/curator/blob/CURATOR-397/curator-x-async/src/main/java/org/apache/curator/x/async/modeled/typed/TypedModeledFramework.java)

title: [CURATOR-400] upgrade clirr to fix the check error on java 8
body:
Currently, the `mvn compile` failed on CURATOR-3.0 branch, it turns out clirr maven plugin has bug and can fail on Java 8, the latest 2.8 version fixed those bug, and compiled without error.

Error details:
-------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:clirr-maven-plugin:2.6.1:check (default) on project curator-x-async: Execution default of goal org.codehaus.mojo:clirr-maven-plugin:2.6.1:check failed: Invalid byte tag in constant pool: 15

title: add fangmin to the developers section
[CURATOR-394] UnrecognizedPropertyException: "enabled" incompatibility
body:
Here is a potential fix for the issue folks. Let me know what you think...

For users who don't want the new "enabled" field serialized, you can create a JsonInstanceSerializer in compatibility mode:

```java
new JsonInstanceSerializer(payloadClass, true)
```

Internally, the JsonInstanceSerializer will not serialize the enabled field. There are tests to ensure that this will deserialize in old clients.

Going forward, JsonInstanceSerializer now sets ignore fields in the ObjectMapper.

title: Fix for CURATOR-233
body: Fix for CURATOR-233.

title: [CURATOR-390] Create better summary of what Apache Curator is/does
[CURATOR-392] Fixing connection string construction for wildcard client addresses
body: The client address in Zookeeper can be a wildcard (0.0.0.0), and if this is used by Curator, it will attempt to create a new connection to 0.0.0.0 instead of the correct server address. It is also possible that no client address or port is set, which should be counted as invalid by Curator, since the appropriate information isn't contained in the data sent.

title: [CURATOR-378] Update mvn parent pom, plugin and other dependency version
body: Update the dependencies version to the version which is most widely used.

title: [CURATOR-255] Check empty connection string in FixedEnsembleProvider
[CURATOR-391] Cannot use only Stat version to determine node change
body: Using only Stat version to note node change (for UPDATE event) is not enough. In a split brain if a node delete plus a recreate is missed, the Stat version can appear to be the same. So, when data is available in the cache, compare the data not the stat version

title: [CURATOR-383] Log authorisation error when trying to write node with PersistentNode w/o permission
[CURATOR-311] SharedValue could hold stall data after reconnecting
body: This PR introduces to refresh data when client's state becomes ConnectionState.RECONNECTED.

title: sameThreadExecutor Deprecated
body: use newDirectExecutorService

title: [CURATOR-386] Allow listener to be passed in to PersistentNode
body:
This provides ability to hook into events from PersistentNode when a
node gets created.  PersistentNode would then notify any registered listeners that the 
node was created, along with the path created (useful when protection is used).

title: [CURATOR-367] Delay reconnect on session expired
Update Guava to version 20.0
[CURATOR-171] LeaderLatch isn't aware if it's own ephemeral node goes away
body: The root cause of the problem reported on CURATOR-171 is that LeaderLatch is not aware of losing self znode after acquire lock. This PR fixes that LeaderLatch is aware of my znode losing and marking itself "not leader".

title: [CURATOR-379] unfixForNamespace corrupts child path when it contains namespace
body:
When a child path starts with the namespace unfixForNamespace removes the namespace string, thus creating a invalid path.
With namespace "foo" the result of unfixForNamespace("/foobar") is "bar".

title: [CURATOR-311] SharedValue could hold stall data when quourm membership changes
body: Adding error handling to refresh stale data when stateChanged is called.

title: [CURATOR-331] SharedValue could hold stall data when quourm membership changes
body: Adding a error handling to refresh stale data when stateChanged is called.

title: [CURATOR-279] Semaphore Leases should return the node name
[CURATOR-200] Shade Guava into Curator
body:
Shaded Guava into Curator Client (and Curator Test) so that it's no longer an issue for users. This should have been done a long time ago. Unfortunately, `com.google.common.base.Function`, `com.google.common.base.Predicate` and `com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken` are in Curator's public API so those 3 classes are NOT shaded. However, this won't be a problem because there's no reason to think that Guava will change or remove these basic interfaces.

NOTE: I've tested this by creating a temp project that uses Guava 21.0-rc2. When used with Curator 2.11.1 I get a `NoSuchMethodError`. When used with this new shaded version of Curator there are no errors.

title: [CURATOR-99] Java 8 DSL for Curator
body: Curator Async is a brand new DSL that wraps existing CuratorFramework instances. This new DSL is entirely asynchronous and uses Java 8's CompletionStage mechanism for chaining, composing, etc. Additionally, Curator's original DSL has been cleaned up and simplified, in particular for operations such as create().

title: [CURATOR-370] - Update guava to 18, change use of sameThreadExecutor() to directExecutor()
body: guava update is CURATOR-263

title: [CURATOR-376] InterProcessSemaphoreMutex is not thread safe
body: Set this.lease to null before lease.close.

title: [CURATOR-375] - fix thread interruption being reported twice
body:
In some classes, thread interruption was being reported twice - by setting the thread interrupted flag and re-throwing the `InterruptedException` - this made it look like the thread was actually interrupted twice, and generally causes spurious interruption - even if the `InterruptedException` is handled, the thread interruption status is still set, meaning the next async operation that happens will also fail.

Affected classes:
- `ConnectionState` - `closeAndClear` can never throw `InterruptedException` canyway, so remove the check completely
- `PersistentNode` - as mentioned in the docs for `AutoCloseable`, close methods shouldn't throw InterruptedException anyway. The delete operation is guaranteed, so even if `deleteNode` throws an exception, the node will still (probably) be deleted
- `CreateBuilderImpl`/`DeleteBuilderImpl` - the exception is being re-thrown, so don't need to re-set the interrupt status

title: CURATOR-374: Replace AtomicReferences by AtomicFieldUpdaters to save allocations
[CURATOR-374] TreeCache: reduce memory usage by using AtomicReferenceFieldUpdaters
body:
Reduce memory usage by using `AtomicFieldReferenceUpdaters` rather than instanciating 2 or 3 `AtomicReference` in each tree node.

See [CURATOR-374](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-374)

title: [CURATOR-99] playing around with ideas for Java 8 wrappers
CURATOR-373 Add option to PersistentNode to not overwrite/delete existing node
body: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-373

title: FOR DISCUSSION ONLY - Persistent watch and Cache recipe replacements
body:
I've pushed an implementation for Persistent recursive watches as a ZooKeeper PR for https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-1416 - if it's accepted, Curator should support this. This PR has implementations for:

- PersistentWatcher
- CuratorCache

PersistentWatcher is a wrapper around the new persistent/recursive cache

CuratorCache is a replacement for PathChildrenCache, TreeCache and NodeCache. With Persistent recursive watches the implementation is orders of magnitude simpler and uses a lot less resources (i.e. 1 watch for the entire tree).

title: CURATOR-372 Removed Path from the Compression Provider
body:
This is in accordance to this ISSUE https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-372

We are unnecessarily passing this information to the compression provider.

title: [CURATOR-369] Improve log for new configuration events
body:
Logging the configuration data only after it has been parsed into a `Properties` object. This allows logging readable text instead of an array of bytes.

Also guarded the log statement with a test on the log level, as `Properties.toString()` is a costly operation.

title: [CURATOR-365] backgroundCreateParentsThenNode() ignores exceptions too crudely
[CURATOR-364] Persistent Node Constructor Requires a Started ZK Connection
body:
I have moved the 

```
createMode= useProtection ? client.create().creatingParentContainersIfNeeded().withProtection() : client.create().creatingParentContainersIfNeeded();
```
code segment to the **createNode()** method. Then, an exception will be raised only when you call the `start()` method of the PersistentNode without starting the client. This should be the expected behavior I guess?

title: [CURATOR-361] Prevent removal of leading slash from path when empty namespace used
body: In the test, I'm casting `CuratorFramework` to `CuratorFrameworkImpl` to get access to `unfixForNamespace()`. It was the most direct way to write the test, but I'm open to suggestions for cleaner code.

title: [CURATOR-360] Allow TestingCluster to listen on other network interfaces
body:
Currently, when we create a TestingCluster, all the TestingServers will be bound to the local interface (127.0.0.1). This becomes a constraint if we want to run a TestingCluster which can be used for testing over a network (say LAN).

To provide more flexibility over network interfaces, I have added the concept of **hostname** into the **InstanceSpec** class in this PR.

title: Introduced hostname to InstanceSpec class for improved network interface compatibility
body:
Currently, when we create a TestingCluster, all the TestingServers will be bound to the local interface (127.0.0.1).  This becomes a constraint if we want to run a TestingCluster which can be used for testing over a network (say LAN). 

To provide more flexibility over network interfaces, I have added the concept of **hostname** into the **InstanceSpec** class in this PR.

title: CURATOR-358 - Fixed race condition with getLeader()
body:
-If leadership changes between the getParticipantNodes() call and the getLeader() internal call the NoNodeException is now handled and the next child in the list is evaluated.

Another option would be to just return the default empty Participant object and not iterate over the whole list of participants.

title: [CURATOR-349] Trace the session id even when it is disconnected
body: The default session id inside ZooKeeper is 0, we should keep consistent with it in tracker.

title: [CURATOR-351] Support for TTL Nodes
body: Early PR for TTL nodes support so others can test.

body: explicitly close GZIP input/output streams in GzipCompressionProvider

title: [CURATOR-352] SchemaViolation errors do not contain enough information
body: Better exceptions messaging when there is a Schema violation. This is much more useful for debugging purposes

title: [CURATOR-345] clientAddr might be null in which case addr should be used.
[CURATOR-349] Expose extra metrics in TracerDriver
[CURATOR-349] Expose extra metrics in TracerDriver
CURATOR-350 allow to close executor service on shutdown

body: validateCreate() should be taking a path argument. The class field "path" was hiding this so I renamed that as well.

title: CURATOR-344 - limit shared value watcher to valid change events to av…
body:
…oid work on disconnect.

Test that shows the difficulty with blocking the event thread. 
When the framework is shared and one use case needs timely notification of suspend, a use case that requires retry for some period gets in the way.

In any event, on a disconnect, there may or may not be change, it does not make sense to me that the listeners should be fired.

title: CURATOR-341: Don't retry create operation after setData
body:
Resulted in infinite amount of retries

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-341

title: CURATOR-337: Do not attempt to release a mutex unless it has actually been acquired
body: Do not attempt to release a mutex unless it has actually been acquired

title: CURATOR-337: Do not attempt to release a mutex unless it has actually been acquired
body: \Do not attempt to release a mutex unless it has actually been acquired

title: Long session timeout issue
body: Fix for issue where LOST events were created at 4/3 of the session timeout rather than at the end of session timeout.

title: [CURATOR-331] Make unhandledErrorListenable as public
body: It will allow to add a custom error handlers for the treeCache.

title: [CURATOR-335] InterProcessSemaphoreV2 can deadlock under network stress
body: If there is a network event after the semaphore's node is created but before getChildren() is called, the previous implementation would orphan the newly created node causing a deadlock later on

title: [CURATOR-332] Internal watcher tracking for new WatcherRemoveCuratorFramework feature is not correct
body:
Reworked WatcherRemovalManager. It now stores watchers only on successful operations. This is more like how ZK does it.

Also, exists watcher must be stored when there is a NoNode result.

title: CURATOR-329 - SharedValue does not update to current value if zookeeper node version is 0
body: Fixed SharedValue class to correctly update its value on start() call to value stored in Zookeeper node if node version is zero.

title: [CURATOR-328] PathChildrenCache was not handling CONNECTED state
[CURATOR-326] exists() with createParentContainersIfNeeded was ignoring too many KeeperExceptions
body: exists() with createParentContainersIfNeeded was ignoring too many KeeperExceptions and thus hiding connection problems. Should only ignore node exists/not-exists

title: [CURATOR-327] -  NamespaceImpl does not report full error message to caller
[CURATOR-308] Parent container deletions could cause a hang
body: Parent container deletions could cause a hang as the watcher would never fire. If parent containers get deleted now, reset and recreate them

title: [CURATOR-324] Test for event ordering in both caches
body:
@dragonsinth Please pull then modify this branch...

This test randomly creates, updates, deletes nodes and records events as they come through both PathChildrenCache and TreeCache. On every run that I try, TreeCache will occasionally send TreeCacheEvent.Type.NODE_ADDED for the same node. It appears to always happen after that node has been deleted.

title: [CURATOR-322] Schema/documentation support
body: See Issue for details: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-322

title: initial work on schema validation
[CURATOR-299] WatcherRemovalManager must be updated when there's an exception, retry, etc.
body: If there's an exeption, retries exceeded, etc., the watcher was still being stored in WatcherRemovalManager thus causing it to be incorrectly removed. This fix removes the watch from the WatcherRemovalmanager on exceptions, retries exceeded, etc.

title: CURATOR-317: changed a deprecation comment to provide a better equivalent
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-317

Now anyone looking at the deprecated annotation will find code that is a drop in replacement.

title: [CURATOR-315] Reconnect during InterProcessSemaphoreV2.acquire can lead to orphaned node
body:
Only add successfully acquired leases to the builder passed to internalAcquire1Lease. Close leases on other return paths.
This ensures that acquire does not return more leases than requested, as it is expected by the convenience methods for acquiring a single lease.

body: 验证替换mafka做指令执行通知的示例代码

title: [CURATOR-314] Listenable support for GroupMember recipe
body: I've added support for listenable events to the GroupMember recipe. Its built on the event support provided by the underlying PathChildenCache object being used by GroupMember

title: [CURATOR-310] Race in PersistentNode startup
body: This is a semi-punt but a reasonable one. The simple solution is for the client to call waitForInitialCreate() before calling setData(). So, now, setData() throws an exception if the initial create has not occurred.

title: [CURATOR-306] Background operations would benefit from an optional error handler
[CURATOR-305] Async multi calls not returning error code
body: CuratorTransactionImpl.makeCuratorResult() needs to check for ErrorResult and return it in CuratorTransactionResult (new field probably needed).

title: Support EPHEMERAL_SEQUENTIAL nodes for ServiceDiscovery instances
body:
Added a new DYNAMIC_SEQUENTIAL  ServiceType for ServiceDiscovery instances, which creates EPHEMERAL_SEQUENTIAL nodes in Zookeeper. Before this patch only EPHEMERAL or PERSISTENT nodes were supported by Service Discovery.  
[Jira issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-304)

title: CURATOR-262: Fixed integer overflow issue with sleepMs
body: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-262

title: NamespaceWatcher should only equals other NamespaceWatcher
body: @Randgalt

title: Don't allow NamespaceWatcher to compare equal to a raw Watcher
body: Don't allow NamespaceWatcher to compare equal to a raw Watcher or CuratorWatcher. It can't be done reciprocally in a raw Watcher and is actually unnecessary. NOTE: a Curator Tech Note should be written to warn that Watchers are wrapped internally

title: TreeCache debug logging
body:
Debug logging I found useful for debugging the killedSession() problem.
@Randgalt

title: CURATOR-302: fix TestTreeCache.testKilledSession()
Major re-work of Watcher wrappers
body: Major re-work of Watcher wrappers. It really isn't necessary to keep a map of watchers. It was originally done so that watcher identity was maintained, but this can be achieved much easier using special-purpose hashCode() and equals() on NamespaceWatcher.

title: [CURATOR-297] Handle quick close after start for PersistentNode
body: Because start() creates the node async, if close is called immediately, it might occur before the node creation. Handle this edge case by having the background response delete (async) the node if the instance has been closed

title: [CURATOR-298] Only create parent nodes in foreground if buildInitial is true
CURATOR-294: Optimize TreeCache, fix possible concurrency issue
CURATOR-294
body: @Randgalt

title: [CURATOR-290] Make sure NamespaceWatcherMap is cleared
body: Make sure NamespaceWatcherMap is cleared when the corresponding watcher is removed via new APIs. Added tests to ensure this.

title: [CURATOR-208] General fix for catch-alls throughout the code and interrupts
body: General fix for catch-alls throughout the code. This is overkill but it strikes me as the safest way to address the problem. Everywhere there is a catch-all add a check for InterruptedException and reset the thread's interrupted state

title: Added TreeCacheSelector to allow for controling which nodes a TreeCache processes
